ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:0.6_0: Venerables, these one hundred and sixty-six rules on offenses entailing confession come up for recitation.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.2_0: At that time a lay follower had invited the Sangha of nuns to ask for garlic:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.3_0: “If any of the nuns need garlic, I’ll supply it.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.4_0: And he had told his field-keeper,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.5_0: “If the nuns come, give two or three bulbs to each nun.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.6_0: On that occasion they were holding a celebration in Sāvatthī,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.7_0: and the garlic was used up as soon as it arrived there.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.8_0: Just then the nuns went to that lay follower and said,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.11_0: As soon as the garlic arrives, it’s used up.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.13_0: The nun Thullanandā went to the field, and not having any sense of moderation she took a large amount of garlic.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.14_0: The field-keeper complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.15_0: “How can the nuns not have any sense of moderation and take a large amount of garlic?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.16_0: The nuns heard the complaints of that field-keeper,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.17_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.18_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā not have any sense of moderation and take a large amount of garlic?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.19_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.22_0: “How could the nun Thullanandā not have any sense of moderation and take a large amount of garlic?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.23_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.24_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.25.1_0: “Once upon a time, monks, Thullanandā was the wife of a brahmin.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.28_0: When that brahmin eventually died, he was reborn as a goose,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.29_0: whose feathers were all made of gold.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.30_0: And he gave his former family members one feather at the time.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.31_0: Thullanandā considered this. She then grabbed hold of that king of geese and plucked him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.32_0: But when his feathers regrew they were white.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.33_0: At that time too, monks, Thullanandā lost her gold because she was too greedy.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.34_0: Now she will lose her garlic.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.35_0: “One should be content with what one gets,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.37_0: After grabbing hold of the king of geese,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.38_0: The gold came to an end.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.39_0: Then, after criticizing the nun Thullanandā in many ways for being difficult to support ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.40_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:1.41.1_0: ‘If a nun eats garlic, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.1.6_0: from Magadha is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.1.7_0: If she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.1.8_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.1_0: If it is garlic and she perceives it as such, and she eats it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.2_0: If it is garlic, but she is unsure of it, and she eats it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.3_0: If it is garlic, but she does not perceive it as such, and she eats it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.4_0: If it is not garlic, but she perceives it as such, and she eats it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.5_0: If it is not garlic, but she is unsure of it, and she eats it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.2.6_0: If it is not garlic and she does not perceive it as such, and she eats it, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.5_0: if it is a spring onion;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.10_0: if it is a special curry;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.12_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc1:2.3.13_0: The first rule, the training rule on garlic, is finished.
